column4: you should always be able to boot from a live cd or live usb to install a OS. you do have a live CD?
i have no livecd/dvd was trying to do a liveusb but when im trying 12.04 version it doesnt boot, and when i tried 10.04 version it boot but i had error when it was checking cd rom
do you have a usb stick that you can make into a live usb? and will you rig boot from usb? or check the iso's md5 check sum and burn the CD again, then have CD check itself for errors.
omg i understood only 3 words from what u said :D
ok, I'll go slow, do you have a usb Flash Drive that you can burn the ubuntu 12.04 ISO to?
i already tried but it didnt worked fine :(
where did you get the iso you are using(link plz), what OS are you using to create the USB, Do you know How to set the BOOT order in your computers BIOS?
you can use "md5sum <nameofISOfile>" and check that it downloaded correctly by comparing it to the md5 value on the download page
you mamage to check the md5sum of your ISO file?

reading guide how to install ubuntu on it

but i just installed win7 from that usb so...
